dialog.line: Sarah, your phone keeps ringing, do you want it in the bathroom?
Well I'm here now. Wait a minute, this isn't your phone.
I should know, I bought your phone for you only a month ago, I didn't get you a WAP phone with a camera, these cost a fortune. Where did you get it?
But it's so much more expensive than yours, Sarah.
Yeah well, that new girl Jackie wants to get in with everyone, so she offered, she didn't mind, honestly. She'll get another one.
I've had enough of this. Get out of that bath now and come downstairs. I want to talk about this once and for all.
Nothing's going on Mum. I told you, I swapped the phone with Jackie.

There is no new girl in your class called Jackie, Sarah. I phoned Rachel's mum because I had a suspicion the phone was hers, just like the t-shirt. You got the phone from Rachel. The CD was hers as well, wasn't it?
I just borrowed it, I told you.

You told me you borrowed it from the non-existent Jackie, you told me the t-shirt was Justine's, you told me the phone was swapped. Why should I believe anything you say about all this? Whose were all those pens?

So you say. Look Sarah, you've either been stealing these things or you've been forcing people to give them to you. Is that why you and Rachel aren't friends any more? Come on, no more lies, it will only make things worse. What have you been doing?
